definition: to give a lecture/to lecture on
owner/master/host/individual or party concerned/God/Lord/main/to indicate or signify/trump card (in card games)
to speak/to explain/to negotiate/to emphasise/to be particular about/as far as sth is concerned/speech/lecture

sentences.english: Let us suppose that you have been asked to introduce the main speaker at a meeting.
sentences.chinese: 讓我們假設你被要求在會議上介紹主講者。

sentences.english: Chinese church pastor who sings Hokkien songs preaching English sermons, isn't that very special?
sentences.chinese: 一個唱福建歌的中文堂牧師主講英文信息，很特別吧？

sentences.english: Preached by pastor milton lee using mandarin .
sentences.chinese: 李嗣貴牧師用國語主講。

sentences.english: Business english certificate flash video lecture delivered by new oriental.
sentences.chinese: 商務英語中級課程由新東方講師高崧主講。

sentences.english: The speaker Mr. Tong Siang Eng is a long-time researcher of woodcut art in Singapore.
sentences.chinese: 主講人董長英先生長期研究新加坡木刻版畫藝術。

sentences.english: For the more than 30 well-known e-commerce companies and networks of economic training speaker.
sentences.chinese: 爲超過30家知名企業主講電子商務及網絡經濟培訓。

sentences.english: By the time the speaker entered the hall, all the listeners were seated.
sentences.chinese: 就在主講者進入大廳的時候，所有的聽衆都坐好了。

sentences.english: Imagine going to a conference or big meeting where are you the main speaker, and you only prepare your speech minutes beforehand.
sentences.chinese: 你自己是主講人，卻只是在會前準備了那麼幾分鐘。

sentences.english: Oh, my God, you really want me to be the keynote speaker?
sentences.chinese: 我的天啊你真的要我當主講人嗎？

sentences.english: Preached by Pastor Jerry Chong using Cantonese.
sentences.chinese: 張仲偉牧師用粵語主講。

sentences.english: It is my honor to introduce (to you ) today's keynote speaker , Prof. Lee .
sentences.chinese: 很榮幸向各位介紹今天的主講人李教授。

sentences.english: Preached by Elder Milton Hwang using Cantonese.
sentences.chinese: 黃燊權長老用粵語主講。

definition: head/director (of an organizational unit)/(police) commissioner/inspector-general/rank of local governor in Tang dynasty administration
the head of an institution whose name ends in 院[yuan4]/chair of a board/president of a university/department head/dean/premier of the Republic of China/CL:個|个[ge4]
specially engaged/employed or commissioned for a special task
